title.narrative: VET TOOLBOX 2: Enhanced Delivery of Demand-driven Skills Development for Investment in Africa

description.narrative: The overall objective of the action is: Better meeting of human capital needs of value & supply chain development and investment programmes in selected countries in sub-Sahara Africa. The specific objective of the action is: Enhanced delivery of demand-driven skills development and VET, catering for investment needs.
Toolbox is delivered through an implementation partnership.

VET Toolbox 2 is an EU-funded project to support the human capital needs of value and supply chain development and investment programmes in 11 countries in sub-Sahara Africa. It is being delivered by a consortium of European development cooperation organisations led by Enabel (Belgium), which includes the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ), Luxembourg Development Cooperation Agency (LuxDev), Expertise France (France), as well as the British Council. The project runs from September 2020 to August 2024.
The focus of the project is on enhancing the delivery of demand-driven skills development and VET catering for investment needs in the 11 countries, through targeted skills development and VET programmes. British Council is the implementing organisation in two countries, Ghana and Malawi.
The project has three delivery strands:
Enhanced national public-private dialogue on employment-oriented skills development and VET Enhanced capacity for demand-driven skills development and VET Stimulated knowledge exchange on lessons from practical experience in delivering skills development and VET in investment contexts.

• The participating local enterprises benefitting from investments • The employees that undergo (continuous) vocational training • Vocational Training Center apprentices and interns, in sectors related to investments • Job seekers, including disadvantaged groups etc.

name.narrative: This is a regional programme. The activities are managed from British Council offices in Accra, located in Ghana and Lilongwe, located in Malawi and delivered across Sub-Saharan Africa.
